name: Droid G - The Gnutella 2 client for Android
tagline: Droid G - Gnutella client on Android phone
body:
### Welcome to Droid G - Gnutella client for Android
This android client is presented to you by Toxic-lab (HK).
This client makes use of the Phex source code as the backbone to communicate with the Gnutella network. Using this android application, client can search and download files, songs, movie directly using their mobile phone.
This definitely save your time compare to using Gnutella client on computer and then connect your PC and mobile phone using a USB wire and then transfer the file.

### Warning
The Gnutella network is not working properly because the LimeWire has been torn down in 2010.[1]

### Development
This project is developed initially using Eclipse back in 2009. This project has been reformed to become an IntelliJ IDEA Project. You can download a copy of IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition at <https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/download/>.

This project is developed using the following Java libraries:
* Phex project <http://www.phex.org/>
* Bouncy Castle <https://www.bouncycastle.org/java.html>
* Commons Codec <https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec/>
* Commons Collection <https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-collections/>
* Commons Http Client <http://hc.apache.org/httpclient-3.x/>
* Commons Lang <https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/>
* Logback <http://logback.qos.ch>
* xSocket <xSocket>
